concept-wr.title: Memory Profiles
concept-wr.shortdesc: A memory profile is a named assignment of memory on a compute host for platform and VM use.

conbody.draft-comment: US66653 new topic created to hold existing content, formerly held as section
conbody.p: Memory profiles are shown on the Memory Profiles tab on the Host Inventory page.
This example lists one memory profile named memprofile-1. This profile assigns 1072 2M hugepages and no 1G hugepages for use by VMs, and reserves 1200 MiB for platform use.
To delete memory profiles, select the check boxes next to the profile names, and then click Delete Memory Profiles. This does not affect hosts where the profiles have already been applied.
